text: If you like Italian foods as me and you should give a try this restaurant. I wasn't know which Italian restaurant was good in this area for delivery but I glad that I tried this restaurant. Food(3.5/5)-I ordered Spaghetti con Langostini, steamed broccoli for the first time also ordered Branzino Grigliato, Cozze e Vongole, Rigatoni alla Norcia for the second time. Spaghetti con Langostini was good and their Langostini was fresh and big. Steamed broccoli was nothing special but they gave me service of chocolate cookie(it was amazing good tasted) with some bread. Bread was cold and I didn't enjoyed eat but foods were still hot when they delivered to me. This place pasta was little hard but theses days I like eat hard pasta than before cuz in my opinion it taste better also you can taste of sauce very well if pasta noodle is harder than soft. Branzino Grigliato was smaller than I expected. I personally thought it cost expensive than food quality. Vongole was good but not the best, I had been eat better elsewhere in NY. Vogloe is my one of favorite dish so I could tell you that this place vogloe was good but don't expect too much. I strongly recommend you should have try Rigatoni alla Norcia here. Sauce was fully flavorful. I've eaten many of pink sauce but I could tell you this place pink sauce was top list. My friend was choosing my pasta and I really thankful to my friend for Norcia. Service(4/5)-Even you order foods here for delivery, it was hot and nice delivery service. They delivery packing service was amazing. They made sure my food was hot and didn't licked. Bit I only wish they'd give me warm breads instead of cold bread. It would better if they didn't give me breads.
Amazing authentic Italian food. Stumbled upon this location while looking for a meal after a show. The staff and ambience were very friendly and inviting. Loved eating here!
Totally solid place.  Bordering between 3 and 4.  Nice salad and octopus.  Pastas including the tortellini with spinach and ricotta was very good, fusilli norcia was ok. Chicken Milanese looked good.
Probably one of my favorite little eateries in Hell's Kitchen. I go here often and it never disappoints.

Went here tonight to have dinner before seeing a show. Celebrated my sister's 30th birthday. Such a cute looking spot! I don't remember the waiters names, but every person who waited on us was so nice and very attentive. There was a pasta dish I wanted that was only on their brunch menu, but they still made it for me anyways. I had the Kinktini (something like that lol) really good!! The mussels were also amazing! We ordered 3 different pasta dishes- everything was so good! I also asked them if they could make a special dessert platter for my sister and they did it perfectly! Wish I remembered the waiters name and the others who waited on us too, thank you for the great service! I highly recommend this place and will definitely come back!

So - my meal was great - and our waiter was very capable and accommodating. However - my dining partner's meal was a nightmare. For dietary needs, he ordered the gluten free pasta. When it came out, it was so undercooked you couldn't even get a fork through it. Our waiter immediately asked if everything was ok, and of course, we sent the meal back. It took them over 35 minutes to replace the meal. I was done with my meal before his ever even showed up. The waiter kindly bought him a glass of wine while he waited. He kept us updated on the progress (or lack thereof) on the (very simple) pasta throughout. Even when the meal finally showed up, the pasta was still undercooked (what was happening for 35 minutes?!?) but edible. Very disappointed in the kitchen, not the wait staff.
If you don't eat here you're a dweeb. Food is phenomenal, the prices are amazing and the service is next level. Looking forward to coming back.

Great restaurant in midtown! The food blew me away! I had the spinach tortellini. Was both timely and beautifully presented. The restaurant was very busy and a little loud, but an overall delicious experience. Must have Italian in NYC!

I frequent this restaurant for brunch as I enjoy the variety of options offered and their $20 pitcher of mimosas! Food is tasty but service can be a hit or miss depending on who you get. It's a cozy space. They also have a great Italian wine selection!

Not bad. Pretty empty - we were the only table there on an albeit rainy Sunday evening around 8pm. Fast and friendly service. Started with complimentary bruschetta, which was tasty. Ordered the calamari appetizer, which came with fried zucchini. It wasn't bad - about average. Don't think I would order it again. Didn't love the homemade squid ink pasta, which tasted a little fishy, but the fettuccine alla bolognese was good.

This place is awesome, tonight Simone is our beautiful waitress, and Raffe is our bus help. The restaurant is packed with beautiful people everywhere. The dinner is fabulous, truly wonderful. I recommend Bocca Di Bacco to anyone needing a great meal and to get to the theater on time!

My wife and I went out with a few friends for a special occasion. the waitress was very rude and rushed us to order. Later in the night when we asked for a wine suggestion, she was annoyed. she said whatever you like when we asked for white wine, she did not care. The waitress never checked on our table she checked on other tables but not ours.  Then she came and complained about her tip claiming all customers tip her 20% she asked us why we did not tip her a higher amount. when we explained why we were dissatisfied with the service. She said I have been a waitress for 20 years and was very defensive. Worst service ever I will never eat here again.The manager did not help all he did was shake our hand and tell us to come again. Horrible service and mediocre food for the price.

My first experience at Bocca di Bacco was great!I got to try an appetizer made with eggplant and ricotta and 4 pasta dishes:Pappardelle alla bolognese, carbonara, ravioli ricotta e spinaci, gnocchi alla sorrentina.I went on a Sunday for brunch and they have live music with a dj.Isabella, one of the manager and waitress was super nice and accomodating.Will go back.

Loved it.  The staff was friendly and attentive. Out meal was delicious.  I had the homemade pasta special with lobster and shrimp. It was excellent.  Great vibe and a great selection of wine.   Out waiter was Nunzio! Loved it.

My colleagues and I came here for lunch. We ordered from their Restaurant Week menu. Overall this place is decent. It's not too busy during lunch time. The food was pretty good. Crab cake, spaghetti, and tiramisu were all delicious. We were all happy about the food I got. I would recommend octopus on the menu. It looks amazing. $26 for 3 courses was a amazing deal. Usually it's for two courses. There is vegetarian option on the menu, which is great. The service was subpar. Even though the restaurant was not busy, we stood at the door for 5 minutes to get someone to sit us. Then we sat for another 15 minutes to get the waiter to take orders. Lunch took us almost two hours. Waiters were not very friendly either. But the bottom line is, they did their job.
Yummy food if you do not mind waiting for your table, even with a reservation. We have dined here often pre theater and this situation is a regular occurrence. The restaurant is poorly managed.

Delicious. Order comes on time. Staff is helpful when ordering over phone and made suggestions for substitution when needed. Everything I've ordered from there has been a winner especially the Italian sausage pasta. Look forward to visiting restaurant for full experience. The food was tasty, flavorful and good abundant portions.

I had been eyeing up Bocca Di Bacco for a while, so we decided to have dinner here before seeing Book of Mormon. It was good, the dishes were fresh. The light above our table was out so it was a bit hard to see, but it happens. Would recommend!

This was a great little place to have dinner before a show. The food was good, drinks were good and service was good. Nothing outstanding, but still very solid place! The tortellini was pretty amazing though! Definitely Try it!!

I was the first Yelper to write a review about Bocca Di Bacco in 2012, this is now a much needed update. I said I hope this place picks up? It was packed on Friday night! I have theatre tickets and we need to secure dinner reservations. Carmines? WAS ON FIRE YESTERDAY, Not to fear, I know Bocca Di Bacco was a solid choice. My sister in law was craving Spaghetti with bolognese sauce, I knew Bocca Di Bacco has it down along with their freshly made pasta. My wife ordered a calamari (Its not pronounced GALAMAD) starter as well as a board with some beautiful looking crostinis. The cal-A-Mari (It's easy to say, don't embarrass yourself) has baby octopus as well as fried zucchini chips. Soooo good!I read the menu, my go to meal is a big plate of Fusilli. Add Italian Hot & Sweet sausage in a cream sauce, now we're talkin' baby. Mmm mm!My niece wanted carbonara which wasn't on the menu. Uncle Billy, I can they make it for me when we go? Our waiter said not a problem sir. Everyone is happy, great food in a very hip setting.I look over to my sister in law with bolognese sauce on her chin. She's in the zone. Thanks Bocca Di Bacco.

I have visited this restaurant for dinner. We did not have a reservation; however, they were able to seat us swiftly. The bread with the tomatoes that they bring to the table were pretty good--I asked for extra tomato dip. For an appetizer we ordered the calamari which everyone loved. The calamari also comes with fried zucchini chips, which are pretty tasty with the tomato sauce also. I ordered the spinach tortellini and added mushrooms, and devoured the entire plate. A few my friends got the squid ink pasta and loved it and the other two got gnocchi and they also loved it. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for dinner!

Had our reserved table when we arrived a little early. It was in the back by the kitchen which I wasn't thrilled with at first but with two kids (9 & 11) it turned out to be best. More room and quieter. Had the cured meat appetizer which was fantastic. Fresh bread with bruschetta was very good. Kids split meat sauce dish - tasted a little sour. Other dishes included minestrone soup - very good. Caesar with massive amounts of cheese - just meh. Pork chop and veggies was excellent. But let me talk about the best parts. Service. Service. Service. And the cheesecake. Highly recommended. We'll just try different dishes.

Excellent service and AMAZING food!  My husband had the grilled calamari as an appetizer and loved it. We also had the Spaghetti & the Risotto with mushrooms and truffles. So good!  For dessert, I highly recommend the Pannocata.
Fantastic restaurant in Hell's Kitchen! Great atmosphere, and the food is to die for!

Though the restaurant itself is attractive and the staff mean well, stay away at all costs. EVERYTHING is sooooo salty, the noise level is unbearable and the food overall is entirely mediocre. Poor value for the cost.
Very good food. We had an amazing arugula salad. The eggplant involtini and homemade gnocchi were very good. Wine a bit expensive but it is NYC. Pretty authentic.

Nice place, but the waiter did not bring what we ask for (the entree). Also, there was a plastic in my plate. Additionally, the manager who was in the restaurant, did not come to talk with us to give an explanation, even to at least say goodbye. The restaurant made a discount in our check, but that's not the solution, they need to improve service.

Been here a few times now.  It's not god-awful, but more like a bad date you wonder why you still hang out with?   So this is what i think of Bad Bocca: Better pasta at a pizzeria (think fusilli with jar meat sauce), but sometimes cool bartender (and sometimes not as tonight)..  You decide (but hopefully on someone else's dime).  All in: avoid, you can do better!

I've eaten here a few times but not for a long time and things seem to have declined considerably. Almost every server didn't seem to understand what we wanted but mainly, when we told them about the issue he didn't do anything about it. My husband ordered the stead med-rare and it was well done...even charred to some degree. Then he ordered a double espresso and got a single. Let me say that I got the lamb chops, which were melt in your mouth and truly the saving grace of our meal (i gave him half my food because he didn't want his steak). It's a place I would normally go back to but will probably try something else next time.
Okay Italian place. Large bar. Friendly service.Nothing spectacular, sad to report

So delicious and cozy and welcoming. My daughter ordered spaghetti with marinara sauce. It was so good. Truly perfect, the best version of a favorite dish I have ever had. I wished I had ordered it! My sea bass was good. The eggplant appetizer was so good. It had mint, which was unexpected and delightful. The bread was delicious.

Was here with my girlfriends for lunch on a Saturday before a show. Disappointed that only selections from a limited brunch menu were available. Two of us ordered pasta and another friend and I ordered a vegetable panini (the only vegetarian dish) on the menu. The pasta sauce was salty and the panini ciabatta bread was greasy. Very disappointed with the meal.

This place was a nice surprise in the theater district. The atmosphere isn't too touristy, service was attentive and the food was great. Recommend the gnocchi and the chocolate cake with ice cream. Would definitely come back here before another show.

Some friends came in from out of town and I met them for dinner prior to their seeing Kinky Boots later on that evening. They like the restaurant scene along 9th Avenue and wanted to eat at Bocca di Bacco. We walked in and were seated immediately. Water arrived at the table and my friend and I both got a glass of wine; she opted for a rose, I got a glass of Merlot. Italian bread arrived shortly after with EVOO. We looked over the menu and the both of them opted for soup and salad. They both ordered the zuppa di fava-a creamy fava bean soup with spinach, mushrooms and goat cheese. They both ordered the bresaola e pere salad made with arugula, imported bresaola, [like a prosciutto] bosc pears parmesan cheese and balsamic vinegar. I opted out of soup and salad and ordered the orecchiette in salsa di ragu d'agnello-the small ear, hat shaped pasta with lamb ragu sauce. Our meals were delicious. Two of us ordered espresso and the third got a cup of cafe americano. We were full and did not each want a dessert but ordered biscotti to share among the three of us. They too were excellent. The waiter was attentive and accommodating and the restroom was clean and well maintained. I would recommend and return especially if you have out of town guests coming in to see a show.
Solid choice for drinks and/or dinner in HK. The place has a moody/sexy vibe. The staff are terrific. Every category on the menu offers delicious options. I highly recommend.

When we checked in for our reservation, they tried to seat our party of six at a table for four. When we said it would be very uncomfortable for six adults to sit at a table for four the manager was very rude to us in his response. He told us if we were unhappy we should leave. He also would not give us his name. This happened on Saturday , 6/30 at 5:00 pm. We proceeded to walk to the end of the block and have a magnificent meal at Cara Mia 623 9 th Ave.  As New Yorkers we expect better!! Shame on him!!

OMG!  Talk about an amazing Italian experience in Chelsea!  I was able to try entrees I haven't been able to find back here in Colorado.  Not to mention, the seafood is extremely fresh and amazing!  I think the prices were about right for the quality of food and the setting of the restaurant.
What a fantastic brunch! Food was wonderful and service was outstanding. Ask for Gerardo and you're guaranteed a fantastic experience.

For months I've wanted to try this place for dinner but when wondering where to go for brunch my boyfriend and I decided to check this place out. Every Sunday, this Bocca Di Bacco location* has a boozy brunch from 12:00 - 4:00pm and offers a pretty solid deal: $5 for Mimosas, Bloody Mary's or Screw Drivers or $20 per bottle of champagne or $20 for a pitcher of the aforementioned drinks. Walking in, I'd say around 12:30p or so, it was incredibly quiet! It was actually so empty, I gingerly approached the hostess asking whether they were actually open. When she confirmed that they were, she escorted us towards the back where we sat at our table. The overall ambience is pretty intimate and the interior very rustic and romantic. However, when the "soulful house" music being spun by the DJ come on this place immediately becomes more cool and laid back. Enjoying the music and ability to hear one another, our waiter brought over some water and menus. There was a lot to choose from under the usual egg category but there were some panini and pasta options as well. While contemplating food, they brought out some biscuits and cubes of butter and globs of strawberry jam. It was a welcomed change from the typical bread and butter other restaurants might have offered up.We first settled on a pitcher of mimosa, which was about 3 glasses each saving us $10 had we decided to order individual glasses for $5 each. The money we saved ended up going towards our appetizer: calamari with a surprise guest appearance from zucchini (served with a side of the usual tomato sauce). It was really crispy and well done! Our mains consisted of one four cheese omelet with Swiss, Fontina, Mozzarella and Cheddar and the Frittata e Peperonata (eggs with sweet peppers, onions and mozzarella). Each main comes with home fries and greens however I substituted my home fries for two pieces of toast. The eggs were exploding with cheese and when I created an egg sandwich for myself it really hit the spot! My boyfriend enjoyed his main as well but would say it was good, not great.As time went by, the venue became much more crowded and fairly loud - though we could still hear each other properly. The crowd was primarily smaller groups of people who are likely at an age where having low key Friday nights are ideal and wine and cheese instead of chips and gauc are preferred. Kidding. Well, not really. The point of my saying this is that it's a very tame, low key crowd. In fact, Bocca seems to be fairly laid back themselves as there were two tables across from us reserved for someone who had just graduated. A woman was setting up those trendy Mylar helium letter balloons and decorated the tables as she saw fit (i.e. flowers, photo booth type décor with little photos propped up). It was nice to see that Bocca would let their guest(s) have full creative control. Overall, this is a pretty decent place and I would be happy to come back!*There are three locations: the Theatre District, Hell's Kitchen and Chelsea

We stumbled upon this chic looking restaurant as we were walking along 9th ave, looking for an Italian restaurant. Good thing about Italian restaurants is that they usually have good vegetarian options and almost something for everyone. We started off with the cocktails and two appetizers - flatbread and mussels. The broth in the mussels was great and the mussels themselves were fresh. Flatbread for me was nothing special, it was a bit mush and way too loaded for my liking. Cocktails were tremendous and a hit overall. For the main course, we got a lamb shank, angus steak and tortellini. All items were ok but lacked attention to detail, as the lamb shank was over seasoned and the tortellini was undercooked. Going past that, we wanted to end our meal with something sweet, so we ordered a creme brûlée and the tiramisu -  both of which were home runs and helped us end our evening on a high note.This place has all the right ingredients to be amazing but needs focus to make the parts that are not so good be wonderful.
We cannot believe how good the food, service and ambiance were! Incredible in every way.

I wish this place was in my hometown.  I'd be a regular.  So me and my travel companion came here one evening after a long day of sightseeing.  We tried going to another place before ending up here, but that other place doesn't tell you they use open table for reservations, so we figured they didn't use it.  Well, honestly, I'm glad they couldn't accommodate us, because we wouldn't have found this place!So this place is small, and it gets loud inside.  It's a tad dark, but the ambiance is sultry and intimate.  Our server was fun and boisterous, and made our evening very enjoyable.We started off with some mussels and meatballs as appetizers, as well as some wine.  The mussels were enthusiastically devoured by my companion who commented that they were the best he's ever had.  The meatballs foreshadowed the rest of the meal for me.  Usually, Italian restaurant meatballs aren't like my Nana's.  They are usually like a kitchen sponge.  These however, were just as good, if not, do I dare say, better, than my grandmothers.  Meaty, juicy, and the gravy that they poured over it just made a great meatball into a world class meatball.For entrees I had the gnocchi and my companion had the squid ink linguine.  They were incredible.  The gnocchi was soft and light, and the pomodoro and mozzarella cheese it was smothered in was incredible.  The linguine had a good amount of seafood, and my companion cleaned his plate.While we were both pretty full, we had to get dessert.  We split the chocolate cake.  It was nice and warm, served with gelato and a homemade raspberry sauce.  It was wonderful.  I only wish we hadn't shared it because I could have easily brought myself to eat the entire thing.So, I'm a big fan.  I'll be back.  This is one of my favorite Italian places now in Manhattan.

We stubbled on to this restaurant. Menu looked good so we tried it. Wonderful joint. Only disappointment which has been in every NYC restaurant is no red zen wine. We had the bruschetta appetizer and the tortellini spinach entree. Absolutely the best meal of the  week. Well done my new friends. We'll return.

Came here on a whim as we didnt want to wait two hours til our reservation at a well known family style Italian restaurant in the the theater district. Best decision!! Food was fresh, authentic, and incredible. Everyone raved about their food which is a rarity with a large group.

Great bartender! Good drinks, nice lighting, the food depending on what you get is great! Only negative is there is no happy hour, but I must say the drinks are worth the price. Been here 3 times, has become a go to spot for me!

The food here is REALLY good!! I'm upset I haven't been here sooner. The octopus was the best I've had and the TORTELLI RICOTTA E SPINACI was to die for!! I could eat that every day for the rest of my life if I could. The decor is beautiful and it's very romantic inside, definitely not like the other restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. The only reason I took off a star is because it took 20 minutes to get our entree after finishing our apps. I hope next time it isn't like that.

Love this place. Food is amazing.!!However they keep shutting down the lunch menu way early. Supposed to go till 4 and they shut it down sometimes before 3:30.Same with weekend brunch.Went there for brunch and they had gone to dinner menu 40 minutes early.It is listed on their hours and the website till 4pm.They're starting to irk me.This has happened not only once but many a time. Change your hours or stick to them.!!

I took a friend here recently for her birthday and we both absolutely LOVED everything we had - from the appetizer, to the entrees to the dessert.  Service was fantastic, atmosphere was pleasant and it really was one of the best meals I have had in the while.  What a nice surprise to find this gem in the theater district.  I highly recommend.

I really enjoyed my time here. Went with a group of 12 to celebrate my birthday. It seems severely underrated. Each one of dishes was great and the service was also amazing. I've been to restaurants where large groups always have mistakes or are neglected in some way - totally not true here. We all enjoyed our time here!

Came here with a group of people for dinner on Friday night. The restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived at 8pm. My husband and I had gnocchi and clam & mussel pasta. The gnocchi was mediocre. The clam & mussels pasta was pretty good, especially the grilled shrimp came with it. You can feel the smoky taste in it. For cocktail, I had Tikitiny which was very sweet and it had a weird taste to it. Do not order it. Service was ok. The waiter didn't come to check on us at all during the dinner, and it took them 30 minutes to serve the entree. Overall, it's a mediocre dining experience.

I've always considered this place a winner. I've been coming here for over five years now and it's always delicious. The wine list is extensive and you can definitely find something to meet your palette. The food is consistently good. From my first visit 5+ years ago until just last week, it always delivers. I find the pastas to be super fresh. The cheese and meat plates are spectacular. And the ambiance is dark, romantic and cozy. Great date spot!

Made a late reservation for 4 at 8:30pm after reviewing the list of participating NYC restaurants for Restaurant Week. Upon arrival was told THIS location is not participating in Restaurant Week. Clearly not stated anywhere on website. Decided to stay, expecting perhaps, a drink on the house, or a complimentary dessert. We got nothing. Good food, mediocre service but won't be back.

If you wanna try a unique, seafood spin on spaghetti, I recommend the Spaghetti con Langostini: it's a spaghetti pasta in sightly spicy marinara sauce under a bed of sliced shrimp, muscles and clams.When I say "slightly spicy"--if you're the kind of person who goes to a Thai restaurant and asks for "very spicy"--you won't even taste the spice in the sauce. The broccoli rabe was also a nice side for the table to pick at. Bocca di Bacco has great atmosphere and impeccable service--a definite Italian-restaurant must in Hell's Kitchen.

This place is tucked off in the quiet part of Manhattan in the theater district. I had 630 reservations to be honest I was skeptical due to the dim lights and lack of crowds. I was wrong I guess looks can be deceiving this placed filled up quickly. This is a perfect place for a family gathering or date night very intimate. They have a great wine selection fellas if it's date night you can't go wrong trust me. I started off with the bruschetta fungi it was so tasty, left me wanting to order another one but again this place is kinda pricey. Once my meal arrived I was impressed it was so authentic I felt like I was in Italy  no lie. The ingredients were so fresh all of my meal was good. The only con was they charge for refills and my son keep asking for sprites 12.00 for cups of soda I mean that's a few 12 packs. Overall I would come back again just without my kid lol

Had a great experience here on a Saturday night. Had a reservation and was seated right away. We started with the baratta and prosciutto special which was awesome. They also give bread with fresh bruschetta for the table. My main course I had the spaghetti which I pictured. It was great!! My boyfriend had the squid ink pasta which he also enjoyed. Sorbet for dessert and we were happy. Great food for a great price. 4 stars because tables are very close together so can feel like you're eating on top of each other.

If you want some good Italian Pasta, I recommend this place. They have multiple locations in the city, and you can always find a spot.The time square location has a collection of wines.The service is quick and the staff is friendly.Good Italian decor, good food presentation.The Veal pasta was amazing.I would return here.

Excellent. I highly encourage reservations, but we walked in early enough that they still had spare bar space. The bar space was also booked we noticed as the evening continued. Everyone was helpful and our server was very informative. I had a special; it was a sea food and olive oil pasta. It included what were easily the best scallops I have ever eaten. The house-made pasta was delicious, the serving sizes were perfect, and the sauce was well flavored. Some of the calamari was a little chewier than ideal, but most was perfect. We had a calamari appetizer was delicious. My partner had a basic pasta with bolognese sauce which had him suggesting a return the next day. The server was helpful with picking wines, which was good as I am not super understanding of my old world wines. I would totally suggest this before a show or for a nice evening out.
Food is consistently delicious.Went on a busy Friday night this time. But server was attentive. The halibut special was great. We also got two pasta dishes. Licked our plate clean.Will be back!

Very underwhelmed.  Came here on a Friday at 9pm and the place was nearly empty, which is not usually a good sign.  The host didn't speak English and couldn't understand me.  The waiter looked beyond disinterested, and was not friendly nor helpful when I had questions.  The complimentary bread they gave was cold and hard.  We ordered:The Burratta and Prosciutto special.  The buratta was good.  The prosciutto was bad, gummy, blah.Chicken Paillard special. This was delicious!  The chicken was super thin and juicy, I really enjoyed it.Tortelli Riccota e Spinaci.  This was DROWNED in pure butter.  The pasta itself was good, but it felt like it was sitting in butter soup.  If the pasta was in a light sauce, it would be outstanding.Overall I would definitely NOT return here.
When has a single shot been $15 per a person? If you're going to pour a double, eat the cost don't charge martini prices!
Manager was beyond rude to us when we asked why the price of a lemon drop shot was the samePrice as a martini. I've never had Such a horrible experience at a restaurant before. Will not be back......

I walked into this restaurant because my hotel was nearby and i was tired. I didn't want to eat alone so i took the food to go (though the ambiance was nice and romantic inside).  I am usually very picky with food especially italian food but I was impressed! The eggplant appetizer was awesome and the pasta was very good. It was heavy and i couldn't finish it but that is because my choice was heavy (gorgonzola sauce). The portions were big as well on the pasta. Overall, it was a nice find and a happy surprise!

The place has really good pasta but not so sure its a great place for kids.Good Italian. We were a group and took 3 kids with us. They did give us kids size pasta dishes but I can't say they were thrilled to do so. We also had to ask twice for bread for the kids...kids are not adults and they need food quicker. I enjoyed the appetizers (grilled calamari, bruschetta, salad) and wine with my friends. Its a good find in the theatre district but not cheap. I liked the dishes on the wall...it added a little sparkle to the place.
Great fun. Great food. Owner is a fun guy, always on premises and this always translates into awesome food :)

I have been to two locations in manhattan, I still think it lacks inspiration overall. the reserve wine is still lacking in excitement, specialty, and depth, its somewhat lower class reserve and researched overall, but with a high price line. The food menu has bi polar opposites, it goes from light and dry, to hearty and hefty, the connection between wine and food needs to respond to each other complimentary. its a good place for wine drastic-s but as a overall experience its ok. the whole experience is casual with a ping ping food/wine/drink.

Our company took us here for a meet and greet after work event. They totally took care of us. There was about 25-30 of us, the drinks and appetizers were flowing and tasty. The staff kept water in our cups, they were attentive and prompt. A place I'd return to on my own.

--Review for Il Bastardo brunch-- (Il bastardo is renovating their primary location but still holding its brunch in the meantime at this location) 59$ entree with personal bottle of champagne,rose champagne,Bellini or Mimosa (comes out to about 75$ after tax and tip) I have never been to the original Il bastardo brunch and this was my first time at Bocca, the location was pretty trendy and cosy looking and they sat my party of 19 at the back corner of the restaurant (perfect for the surprise party we were doing.) Our reservation was for 1:30pm but our table was ready for us we sat down at 12:45 --because we are good friends and wanted to all be on time before the birthday boy arrived so we wouldn't spoil the surprise--. (We ran into an issue with the host because apparently they did not have our reservation but we let them know we made the reservation with the Il bastardo brunch) Once the birthday boy arrived we ordered our personal bottles-I opted for the rose champagne which was totally yummy. The mimosa tasted a bit too sweet for me. The menu was a bit more limited than I preferred.I decided on the Gnocchi but they told me they did not have it...so I opted for the smoked salmon Benedict. About 45 minutes later our food came. Everyone LOVED their food especially the steak and eggs was a big hit with my party. I was a little disappointed with my eggs Benedict (slightly cold and over cooked--no 'yolk porn') The DJ was nestled in a corner of the bar with his equipment resting on glass shelf--really trying to make the best of this location and give the brunch goers the clubby experience that we wanted. Personally, at first we all were annoyed by how loud the music was when we arrived sober since we couldn't talk to each other, but after our personal bottles we did not mind screaming and dancing to every song. Overall a fun afternoon and a great time and the ultimate party brunch. Come with an open mind and get ready to get tipsy!

Went here for Brunch on a Saturday - it was by-far the WORST Brunch I have ever attended in my 8 years here living in NYC. Yes, you get a huge bottle of whatever you want to drink, but the food was actually disgusting. I got the avocado toast and I almost broke my teeth on the actual toast - hard as a rock. 3 people at my table got the burger and had to return it TWICE: 1) they ordered their burgers medium rare and it came out well done and super dry AND 2) what they ordered was not what they received. The menu specified burger, cheese, bacon, egg - it only came with the burger and cheese. It was very disorganized and the food was terrible.

I've been to many brunches in the city and this is by far the worst one.  I called a week before my birthday brunch to reserve a table for 11.  We were seated at a table for 10 right by the entrance.  Granted my 11th guest never showed up but we would've been extremely uncomfortable had he shown up...I even spoke to the manager and asked if we can be moved. He responded by saying that there was only one other table available which seats a party of 20.  That table was NOT reserved and was never used while we were there. My second problem with this place is that on their website they advertise brunch as "PRIX-FIXE $59" nowhere in their website do they state that tax and a mandatory 20% tip isn't included.  Moreover, when I called to make the reservation I asked for the price and was told $59.  not once did they mention that tax and tip was not included in that price. Lastly, at 4:00p.m on the dot the music was cut off and we were basically kicked out of the restaurant. You would think that after spending $760 at a place the manager and staff would be a bit more accommodating. The only good thing about this place was the music. The food was okay and the portions were pretty small. I will not be returning.
Fantastic dirty martinis, warm and friendly service, elegant decor, and expansive and delicious apps (we got a mushroom pizza type thing and deep fried risotto balls). What more could you want?

I love this restaurant! Clean, classy, and great food. They have an amazing wine selection as well. Also Ndary, the bartender on Monday and Tuesdays is phenomenal! He always finds me a new wine i love. Managers are very personable and attentive as well!  Highly recommend!

The food was good once it came but the service was slow and on a weekend evening they were out of certain pasta dishes. We had a reservation but had to stand around the tables that were put together for a while waiting for them to bring over another table to have enough space for the people in our reservation. Once that was resolved, it was otherwise nice. Probably would have enjoyed more in a smaller group.

I came here for brunch for my best friends bday. I gave them a cake to bring out when ready. They completely messed up my cake. They took the entire top layer of the cake off. And placed chocolate on the top. My best friend is allergic to chocolate so that was one. Next they decided to fix it by placing raspberries. Mind you I advised them that she is also allergic to fruits. Then they had the audacity to tell us they weren't billing us for the cut slices. They almost made my best friend have an allergic reaction and end up in the hospital! I'm so completely disappointed. The hostess was absolutely terrible. She kept making excuses brought out the wrong cake. It was just a disaster. I can't even begin with her. Safe to safe we will never return and we will never tell anyone to come here.
Amazing restaurant!  Especially love the chicken and bolognese dishes.  Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Highly highly recommend!!

I came here for a birthday brunch on a Saturday at noon and it was a good experience. It is a sister restaurant to Il Bastardo. They had a dj and they had a prefix menu for $59 per person. It included a bottle of rose champagne, champagne, mimosa or peach bellini. I ordered the peach bellini and the steak and eggs. It was very good and they gave big portions. The food was quick and the peach bellini bottle was so amazing. The dj was good and played a mix of music. The only little complaint I have is that you are kind of forced to get the prefixed menu and cant order just an entree. My friend didn't want to drink but she was kind of forced to because it $59 with or without alcohol. However, it was a very upbeat place with nice staff. The manager was very nice and so was our waitress. The bartender was very accommodating as well. I highly recommend this restaurant for a boozy brunch.

We had our friend's birthday brunch here... food was okay, drinks were a bit better... service turned south once the check was brought out. The check was accurate but when we received the receipts for the split tenders, there was a $25 charge EXTRA on top of each credit card that was given. The server claimed that a certain amount in cash was given to her, when she made one of the guests in the party recount, she said "oh I'm sorry you were right", after which she wanted to run ANOTHER full charge on the credit cards. I know that that the first "hold authorization" would have fallen off but probably after a week. What irritated us the most was the insubordination of the servers and the lack of ownership from the manager. Clearly this business does not put customer's as their priority as I was sitting and waiting for an answer. Only to be served a watered down shot, the lack of professionalism was beyond unacceptable. I would have taken a sincere apology over the poor shot any day.
This was a great spot! Great food! Trendy drinks and fabulous service. Great place to check out.

Terrible experience. We checked the brunch menu online before coming and brought a crew of 8 people for brunch as the prices looked great. As we sat down, they said they only had the $59 brunch menu. After arguing with them, they agreed to move us and give us the regular menu. When the check came, the prices were all twice the price from the online menu. We tried to explain how that is not right to overcharge and not honor the online prices and they wouldn't listen. Never going back again, we all feel robbed. The food wasn't that great either, definitely not worth $20 for eggs.
Great italian food. The octopus appetizer is amazing. I docked one star cos cocktails were ok-good but not great.

Terrible service. Took 40 minutes to be seated for brunch even with a reservation. Finally the waiters and host rearranged tables and chairs (bumping into patrons in the process) in order to seat our party. Expensive brunch price for what you get...pre fixe menu--choice of one mediocre dish and one bottle for 2 hrs. Terrible service to top it off. Bus boys were good with refilling water but that's about it. Had to ask waiters repeatedly for glasses for our drinks. They delivered the bottles with out glasses lol. Lastly, they kicked us out BEFORE our 2 hours were up so they could set up for dinner. This place is a joke, save your time and money and go elsewhere.

Visited for a work lunch today with my team- service was a bit lackluster (only one server was working at first, but then another server came on), and it took some time for us to get seated.As another yelper had noted, service was slow but the food was great! I got the veal pasta (and while they initially brought out the wrong dish), the pasta was perfectly al dente, the sauce was not overpowering and the veal was juicy and tender. My colleagues all got fish dishes (ranging from monkfish, salmon and bronzino) and all enjoyed- the plating was perfect and the fish were cooked to perfection.A great work lunch option if you're in the area! The restaurant has great decor, and also a great wine list! ;)

We go here for lunch at least once a week. Roman, the weekday waiter, is the best. The food is always delicious, and the prix fixe lunch on weekdays is a great value. We've tried most everything on the menu and so far nothing has been less than wonderfully tasty. A leisurely weekday lunch here is such a great way to relax. People have complained that the weekend brunch at B di B is noisy and awful. But real New Yorkers don't do brunch.
Fantastic!! A local directed us here and it did not disappoint. Salmon and Pasta were delicious.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the world. I went there for brunch; it was delicious.I drank champagne, I brought my friends and they all had a nice time.I'll be back next weekend for more fun!
Just came back from Rome, came here and tried the gnocchi. Some of the most true Italian food you can get. Great service, excellent food.

Very over priced and slow service. Much better quality for money in that area. It's always pretty empty which is a good indicator - can always get seated there on opentable. If you need a meal and this is your only option then fine but you're over paying massively and the food is pretty eh. It's there - it just doesn't do a whole lot.

Nice intimate setting.  Good ample portions and reasonably priced.  Octopus appetizer was a sat and out.  Great wine selection at all price points.  Service was very good too.  All in all a very nice dinner experience

Worst brunch experience EVER. Came here for Sunday brunch with friends, and will never return. This place gets 3 strikes for bad service, bad food, and bad music.First things first: the service. We got into a debate with the waiter who said that everything was prix fixe. We didn't want that and wanted to get individual portions. Usually, other restaurants call over the manager and the manager helps work out an exception. Instead of this simple chat with a manager, the hostess (of all people) agreeing to allow us to get individual portions after we said we'd rather eat somewhere else. After that, the waiter was extremely rude to our table for the remainder of the meal. He didn't even complete simple requests for more ketchup, and I had to ask 3 different people for more ketchup before I finally got it. Which brings me to the food. I got a burger because I wanted a hearty and simple meal. The beef was overcooked to a rubbery well done (though I had requested medium), and everything else, like the bun, tomatoes, and lettuce, were really bland. So I hoped the fries would at least save the meal, but also no. They were the saltiest fries I have ever eaten. I literally had to scrape the salt off of every single fry for it to taste normal. Not a fun activity since, I'd rather just be eating the food, not cleaning it.And finally, the music. Oh my god, the music. Everyone appreciates a bit of music in the background while you enjoy good Sunday brunch conversation topics like what you did over the weekend, and what to do in the afternoon. They had a dj in charge of the music, and his song choice made us feel like we were at a high school dance. But the biggest problem was that it was so freaking LOUD. You could only hear the person next to you. The person 2 seats down or across the table? Forget about it. When we left, we had ringing in our ears. If the service had been nice, I wouldn't have been as harsh. If the food was great, I'd give props to the chef. If the music had been pleasant, at least our experience could have been better. But by the time we were leaving, I had never been happier in my life to leave a restaurant.Do yourself a favor and avoid this place at all costs, and go somewhere else. Especially for the price, the food is not that great, and you can have such a better time and deal by going to literally any other place on the block.
Received a warm welcome, accommodated our large party.  Food and service were excellent...prices reasonable.....all of us enjoyed every aspect of the experience...highly recommend!

They had a two course prefix menu for lunch, but most of the things on the menu weren't the same price and you had to add more money in order to eat them. That was a bit of a disappointment. I would've rather the true price is been there and not been surprised by the up charge next to the menu item. The bread was good with a tomato based dipping sauce. Wait staff was fine, salads really big and well presented.

Very loud music makes it difficult to carry on a conversation.  Bocca has installed a large speaker in the main dining area that is too large for the size of the room, and hence the whole dining experience is ruined by the loud music.  According to the manager, this is what diners prefer.  Well, not this diner, and hence the one star rating.

My wife and I were delighted with our entire experience.  It was one of our more memorable meals in the past few years, and we travel frequently.We started with the calamari/zucchini appetizer, which we both agreed was the best we've ever enjoyed.  Very light and delicate.  A real treat.  Not at all the typical fare you find at an Italian restaurant.She ordered the Tortelli Ricotta.  Very yummy fresh pasta in a light sauce with a hint of garlic.   I loved the pasta with bolognese sauce.  Perfectly spiced, and also very fresh.Service was excellent in every respect.

Location: midtown. They said it's time square location but it;s at the border between Time square and Hell's kitchen.Place is definitely looking very fancy. Wine bottles on the wall and everything seemed to be legitWe had brunch, bottomless brunch.Good.The only thing was that it took them a while to order and bring the foood..

A friend and I, who I hadn't seen in a long time, went to Bocca for drinks late Friday night. We spent $100, I picked up the check and left over a 20% tip. We had payed and were drinking water and chatting, the last people in the restaurant besides the staff  sitting and chatting at the bar. Without even a simple, "Ladies, I'm sorry but we're  going to have to close up", the lights go off, completely dark.  My friend asked if she could use the restroom before we depart, as we assumed the black out rudely indidcated  we need to leave. She had to walk down and back a dark and steep staircase with no lights. We left as our table was being bussed and  were asked, "are we done with your water glasses?" UNBELIEVABLE.  This is appauling customer service. Simple respect and communication could have easily left our night with a better ending. I will NEVER go back to this restaurant and will erge my friends to look elsewhere as well.

Not a bad place to have a pre-theater meal. However, the hostess was incredibly rude -- that seems to be a theme if you read other reviews. Perhaps the restaurant will wake up and hire some good people. Upon walking in, there was no one at the host stand for several minutes. When the hostess came back she had a frown on her face, acted annoyed when I said I had a reservation, raced us to our table and threw the menus down and ran away. Not a good start. Our waiter was pretty nice. We had calamari which was a little undercooked. I had fusilli which was decent but not great. My wife had risotto special which she enjoyed. The chocolate cake we had for dessert was good but a bit on the small side. In the end the location is great for eating quick and getting to a show.

Stopped in this restaurant for pre theater lunch. Lovely restaurant by the looks of it, but the selection and food was only so-so.My dining companions and I opted for breakfast instead of lunch because there was more of a choice (i.e. lunch choices severely lacking).We all got an egg dish, omelets. The food was only okay. Toast? Very much in need of immediate change up. They don't offer whole wheat toast. The one and only toast they serve is less than 1/16th inch thick and dry and pretty terrible. Their Web site says they open at 11:00 am, but they seemed to haphazardly open somewhere around noon.With a myriad of restaurants available in that area, I would not choose to go back to this one.If dinner is your thing, then open for dinner only!
A place that never lets me down, what can I say. The way they handle the wine, service, food quality, just amazing. Don't miss the bruschetta
Celebrated p2 of my 35th bday here with 8 friends last friday (4/7) and everything was perfect. Intimate, nice decor and the waiter gave comp prosecco. Will be back!!

Uncomfortable pub chairs in a restaurant.  Bathroom in basement - what about the handicapped access?Servers don't engage but they themselves need the stroking.  No specialties or fun dishes seeming only what foods that need to be moved on from their stock.  Disappointing.

Went for brunch on Sunday.Onion soup for the appertizer was not good.  Very thick, light brown soup with little cheese.Eggs Benedict had dry eggs.  Not enjoyed.  My gf ordered a Bellini and was told no.  My steak sandwich was alright and accompanying french fries were good.  Came with a small salad.  Asked waiter for Italian dressing and he brought me Honey Mustard.  Another waiter approached and I repeated my request.  He asked if I wanted Vinaigrette or balsamic vinegar reduction.  I asked for Vinaigrette and then a minute later he brought me reduction.  Didn't understand that one.They did make sure our water glasses were topped off, which I like.I would not return.  All three food items were not good and we wound up going to another restaurant for lunch.

I came here for dinner on a Sunday night. I think this place might be one of the most underrated italian places in NYC. First lemme start off with the ambiance. Great lighting, music, and hip vibes. Our server Simone was phenomenal. Attentive and there when needed, yet not overly interrupting and chatty as some servers tend to be. Now the food. Wow. We started with the jumbo shrimp, crab cakes, and onion soup. All incredibly delicious. For the entree, I got the lamb ragu with orecchiette. Honestly, and I am not exaggerating, this may have been the best pasta i've had in my life. The lamb was so incredibly tender and was plentiful. Truly amazing. Will definitely be coming back soon.

I honestly wasn't expecting much from this place, but it ended up being delicious! The calamari had avocado on it and was delightful. I also had the lamb chops, which were lean and juicy. A little on the pricy side, but if you're willing the spend a little extra, I would recommend this place.

I was meeting a friend for brunch yesterday and Bocca Di Bacco was our first choice spot.  She got held up on the C train.  While I was waiting for her, I confirmed online that bunch goes till 4PM.  We met and walked the 4-5 blocks up to Bocca to arrive at 3:42PM.  The hostess asked if we were there for lunch.  No, brunch.  She said the kitchen was closed.  Humm, you can serve me lunch but not Brunch?...I stated that both online and on their menu posted on the outside of their restaurant advertise brunch as going till 4PM.  She just stated the same thing.  We left.
Highly recommend this Italian restaurant in midtown. And come hungry, cause plates are very well served and delicious.

I visited today and was very disappointed that my reservation that I made back in February 3 2017 via OpenTable was not honored ... I would like for the manager to get back to me at maya51361@yahoo.com when he or she responds, I will change the rating.Thank you

I have mixed reviews about BDB. I have been here on several occasions. Some food in their menu have good flavors, the food presentation is artistic and the wine list is big BUT, to my every visit, they are served by a mediocre staff. This time around, as if it was getting worse, not only that waiter kept coming back every 30 seconds asking for orders (I was uncomfortably pressured to make a quick choice in span of 3 minutes) but they also turned the music so loud as if the place was a disco techno club. It was clearly appreciated by the 4 customers at the bar and one of them, I suspect, is a friend of the bartender.  When we asked why is the music  so loud? They said they turn it up at the end of night. To drive late diners out? Mind you that was 9pm.Clearly the staff knew zero about hospitality or have heard of the word *CLASS*... considering this is a rather pricey establishment.I ordered a salmon and the medium was served well done and the onion jam was like a "caramelized caramel" yes it was that sweet! It was confusing as to whether I am having a main course or salty dessert. Disappointing.

Originally I had other plans for my birthday dinner but due to unforeseen circumstances we had to switch locations and I happened upon this restaurant. It was one of the few places that took a same day reservation for the amount of people we had. I'm glad we found it though because the food and service was great. We shared the arancini and the mushroom bruschetta which were both delicious. I then had the fusilli with sweet and hot Italian sausage and it was delicious! Then for dessert they brought out a special ice cream dessert and we also had some delicious panna cotta. Delicious! The only reason it's not getting a 5 is because we had to wait for our table but really other than that it was delicious!

I walked in here with a friend at exactly 3:02pm on a Saturday. The place had a few full tables here and there but definitely not packed. We were immediately greeted by a man who (in a slightly annoyed voice) said "We're not serving brunch anymore and we don't serve lunch at all." Ok, well hello to you too, kind sir.  My friend who was as confused as I was said that we had a reservation. At this point, (without saying anything) he started walking toward a table. We followed him and hoped he wasn't planning on killing us. Thankfully, he just brought us to our table and gave us some menus. Whew, am I right?! No idea what the hell that was about.....My friend ordered a mojito ($15) and the chicken entree ($24) which came with potatoes and broccoli. I ordered the Mista salad (14?), which came with almonds and Granny Smith apples. I added some steak to my salad as well. When the drink and food arrived, I was a little confused to see that the waiter gave me a dish that I did not order. I saw a steak with a small handful of greens on the side. Last I heard, a salad with toppings is not the same as a steak and lettuce. Since I am not one to make a fuss, I didn't say anything. They'll figure it out once they read the review, I always say. The good news is that the food was really yummy. Not only was it yummy, it was filling, hot, flavorful and not too expensive. The salad I ordered was about $14 and I assumed I would pay around $12-15 for a small amount of steak. Instead I paid $30 for a large steak and some leaves. For this area, it's hard to find good food at a reasonable price, so I was satisfied with the price I paid. All in all, a good meal. Work on that customer service a bit and you'll be a 5 in no time!
Everything was just good. The food was amazing, everything cooked to perfection. From appetizer to dessert. The molten chocolate cake was among the best I've ever had. Impressed

I've been to this restaurant several times, and I'll keep coming back. We came before a broadway show and they accommodated our time restraints, and had us in and out with plenty of time. We started with an assortment of appetizers, meat and cheese plate, meatballs and the truffle crostini. Absolutely delicious! Then we had the Salmon and Gnocchi and both dishes were great. I swear I've had the whole menu, and love every item! The staff is welcome and friendly! My go to in the theater district!

Had a wonderful meal here. Rice balls and calamari to start. Then fettuccine with meat sauce (exceptional) and tiramisu (the best) for dessert. Bartender was so great we left him a great tip to match his service. Will be returning soon!

Was recommended for pre theatre dinner. Great location , warm interior and service was efficient for the theatre. The octopus appetizer was one of the best I have had, and I have tried all of them. I had a stuffed pork chop that was very tender and still a touch pink as it should be. My wife had a pasta that was very tasty and just enough. There is a broad selection of reasonably priced wine.I will be back on my next trip.Walk up Broadway from the Times Square shuttle, turn west on 54 th Street until ninth Avenue then turn right and you are there, ready for a treat

Good spot on west side near theater district.  Make a reservation as it fills up quickly.  Great cocktails, we had apps (Calamari & Caesar salad) both only OK, but the entrees were very good value -- steak, gnocchi, lamb chops, pasta all very good and the desserts were excellent. Service was attentive & prompt.

Found ourselves looking for an early Italian meal. Was walking towards another restaurant and stumbled upon this gem. Great setting / environment. Had the bean soup which was awesome and the bolognese sauce. Service was attentive and wine was reasonably priced
Great food + good service but below quality front receptionist. No greetings to incoming customers and showed rude behavior with no smile. Owner should hire a professional with service mentality.

Came with the family for Sunday Bruch before B'way matinee.  Very pleasant appearance and service. Food was uneven. We all different omelets Some thought they were very good, but mine, a four cheese omelet was served overcooked and cold. The accompanying salad was underwhelming.  Dessert however, a warm chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream, was delicious.
This place is so nice and the food the staff, the ambiance are so nice, Alfredo the manager was so friendly and attentive that I will be back soon, thank you guys .

WORST MANAGER AWARDWhile the food and the wait staff/hostess was exceptional... the manager (bald guy with tacky goatee) was not. NEVER have I ever had a manager asked me to hurry up my dinner because there are more reservations to be sat. The hostess told us they were fully booked, but could accommodate us with a table for four. This was very nice of her to do. The orders for both appetizers and entrees had been placed, with requested holds on entrees for a few minutes separate from appetizers (if possible). "no problem," the waiter said. About half way through the appetizer, the manager came over to our table (did not introduce himself) requested that we hurry up with our meal because they had a full restaurant of reservations. We were shocked and speechless, because never anywhere in NYC or anywhere else in the world, had a manager asked us to hurry through our meal, especially when we had NO MEAL in front of us to hurry through. Just a little slice of Bruschetta. After getting furious with him that no manager should ask a guest to hurry, because you never know how much money they could spend, we look over and see he has made the hostess cry because he put all the blame on her instead of acknowledging he handled the situation poorly. We walked over to the hostess to calm her and say she has not done anything wrong. Can you imagine trying to eat in an environment where the manager has made everyone uncomfortable?In the end, this restaurants manager thought it be a better idea to upset two parties, both mine and the supposed reservation who had to wait 10 extra minutes... instead of just one.NEVER have I heard of this. I believe he not entitled to run this well established restaurant.He spoils the name and reputation that is Bocca di Bacco.

My girlfriend and I walked in on a Saturday night.  It's a nice, casual dining spot.  Food was good.  We ordered the bruschetta ai funghi as an appetizer and the squid ink pasta and lobster risotto for our mains.  All excellent choices.
Stopped by after a show on Sunday for an early dinner. As always, good food & good friendly service. My friend and I enjoyed everything we ordered. The place remains consistent.
Some of the best food in this part of town, the staff is very friendly, and the decor/atmosphere is pretty cool.  The boozy brunch is excellent, too.

This review is strictly for the theater district location. We got the shrimp linguini, eggs Benedict, frittata, and omelette. I could have done a better job at home. Just average. Nothing remotely special that would bring any of us back!

Great restaurant - I would recommend to anyone...Very fresh food & creative Combos - Excellent drinks & wines as well - Will definitely return - Loved it!  Attentive wait staff - Really enjoyable meal!

Yo. Don't listen to any of the bad reviews. Very classy place nice Decor and great service This place is the BEST. First time I came here I was just walking by and we had the pre fix lunch which was only $14.95 plus a few dollars for add ons. The portions were HUGE. Plus I got Tuna tartare and grilled salmon with carmelized onions!!! Omigod. I could not finish. My friend had the octopus and the Branzino and it was also a giant portion. To our surprise the server gave us a half glass of wine as we departed for no reason. Second time we came here and the restaurant was empty and we came for lunch and had almost the same thing. We started with the carpaccio di Manzo and the fried calamari which were both humongous. The cute little waiter was so nice he gave us a free dessert and a free glass of wine AGAIN!!! I am so impressed by the service and consideration they have for their guests that are repeat customers. Third time I came here was for brunch and it did not disappoint the French toast and the egg white omelette were impeccable and large enough to share and they also still gave us an extra Mimosa as we were leaving. great homey wonderful service. Not sure why this place isn't packed every single day but we need to start helping restaurants like this that deserve it instead of filling it with the tourists that don't know shit.

Stopped here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. Great that they serve brunch from 12-4 coz we are not morning people. Had the frittata and the eggs Benedict and both were perfect. Service was top notch and so is the location and ambience. The only thing that could be better was the cappuccino and macchiato which were both warm and not quite bitter/ strong enough for a true Italian coffee taste. Overall, great experience for brunch. Will try them for lunch and dinner too.

Bocca rocks! I came here for a work dinner. The party was ~20 people and I was told we would sit together. We were given the back area, but it is a small and cozy place so the table arrangement was a bit narrow and it didn't feel like we all were actually sitting together.None the less we had a great dinner. The waiter (Igor?) was a star and ensured we had impeccable service. We went with his wine recommendations for the table and had 2 rounds of appetizers, dinner, and dessert. Everything was delicious. Highlights:Arancini bites MeatballsGrilled octopus Eggplant rollitiniMussels in white wine Lamb shank ( falls off the bone #hearteyes)Seafood pasta !!!BranzinoSalmonThe pasta is great and the Italian style seafood+lamb makes this place stand out. I'll be back one day!

Enjoyable!I've been here a couple times for brunch and enjoyed my experience. The food selection is unique and creative. Everything is presented very nicely but not too flavorful. Portions are small. The drink selection is great - especially the brunch specials.The service is mediocre at best - not very attentive. Overall, pretty good spot and reasonable prices for the area.

Had a late dinner . It was not busy on a Wednesday night . Nice ambiance and decor . Had the mussels for an appetizer, they were a bit small but tasty . Also had the shrimp appetizer , very good . Dinner was good - tortellini and husband has lamb shank . Ample portions . Had a few glasses of wine , bill came to $125 for two. Not bad by NY standards . Only one complaint , the music .... Techno music in a nice Italian restaurant kinda killed the romantic mood ....
Amazing food, would give more than five stars if possible. I would highly recommend the monkfish. Covered in tomato sauce. Or the squid ink pasta and crab meat. Service was phenomenal as well.

Food was pretty good but not great.  Service was fairly poor.  It was quite loud with some kind of fashion show soundtrack.  Large portions, so it's almost 2 meals.  Overall not a bad experience, but I expected more for $30.

First visit. I had the filet which was cooked to perfection. Very moist definitely one of the best steaks I have ever eaten. My friend had the linguini with clams and anchovies. Pasta was homemade. Excellent meal, great service, not overly expensive. Will definitely return.

The spinach tortellini was very good. It was just enough food and the light butter sage was on point. The food was very good the service was a different story. Our server wasn't friendly, he never checked to see if we were okay, if the food was good, if we needed any more wine refills. My table spent 100 dollars and we only have him a 10 dollar tip. I don't believe he should have gotten that. The guy who filled out water at the table, we seen him more times then the server, we told the manager to give that man the tip not our server.

Wonderful wine selection! The bartenders were extremely kind and our drinks were brought to us promptly. We had the cheese plate which was absolutely delicious! The atmosphere is romantic and they had a great music selection. Overall a great experience and lovely service.

Very disappointed that I cut my lip on a wine glass. The waiter informs us that he planned to take off the wine. However his shift changed and the new waiter still charged us. The manager stood behind the decision and still charged us. Therefore, as I nurse my bruised lip, I informed the reluctant manager that my future purchases would be an indication of my present experience. Very disappointed.

Had dinner here last night with my wife prior to seeing a show and was really pleased with everything. We were there early and the place was empty, but it filled up fast with what appeared to be local folks. We split the octopus appetizer. This was the best I've ever had in my life! Beautifully charred on the grill, full of flavor and so tender it melted in my mouth. I would order this every time I came here if I lived closer. My main dish was the black pasta with crab which was perfectly done, al dente, and beautifully sauced with a deeply flavored sauce. My wife had the lamb ragu with pasta and loved hers as well. The pasta was house made and tastes like it. Desert was delicious and we would definitely recommend this great little gem.

The 2 dishes we got tasted good. We got the seabass and the spinach tortellini.  It was very busy that night so it took a while to get our order placed. It also took a while to finally pay the bill. My biggest problem with the restaurant was how extremely LOUD it was in there! All the patrons were yelling, the whole meal. It was so loud, I asked my husband to text me what he was saying because I couldn't understand him. The server had to bend down and yell the specials right in my ear, which I only understood about half.

Food was just ok. Nice ambiance but mediocre food and waitstaff that was not busy enough. I split the aranchini balls with a friend, definitely needed more flavor and sauce. The pasta dish I tried (spinach and ricotta tortellini) was dry and needed more sauce as well. The wine was good though. Overall, not sure I would I come back.

We had dinner here last night, everything was just great!! Our italian server was very attentive and everything he suggested was divine! We had the grilled octopus, bruschetta with mushrooms and truffle oil and as a main i had the special grilled filet mignon and my girlfriend had the gnocchi, they are homemade, amazing!!! The ambience is warm and the have an amazing music playlist!! I will definitely come back!!
food was overall pretty good. main course and desert were good but not great. price was okay. atmosphere was good. probably 4 stars if the waiter wasn't standoffish. Maybe he was having a bad day.

While I do explore restaurants throughout much of Manhattan below 59th St, this particular Bocca Di Bacco is one of my absolute faves, a go-to spot for a reasonably priced relaxed and wonderful dining experience. The staff (especially Alfredo) is always warm, welcoming, friendly, attentive and knowledgable... always really helpful with food and wine suggestions. The food is consistently well prepared, and I've never been disappointed, which says ALOT.  (The grilled octopus is out of this world!) At this price-point, Bocca Di Bacco is definitely a diamond in the rough among restaurants in HK and Theater District!

Friends and I came here during restaurant week.  I was the first to arrive (as usual) so I decided to wait at the bar.  Unfortunately, there was no happy house, so I went elsewhere for a cocktail while I waited for the rest of my party to arrives.We all ordered different things from the menu.  Everything was delicious.  I'm not a big fan of Italian food, but I'd come back.

This place has AMAZING food (seafood, veggie and desserts really stand out). I've ordered many meals here and Bocca di Bacco never disappoints. Despite being an Italian restaurant, the seafood is the star here! Their pastas are generally average tasting but I think their seafood really really stands out. If you are a seafood junkie, you will love this place. The food comes out fast and the presentation is great. My favorites are the grilled octopus appetizer (Polipo Grigliato), beets salad (Insalata Barbabietole Rosse), brussles sprouts side, salmon (Salmone Bocca Di Bacco), branzino (Branzino Grigliato), and chicken (Pollo Al Rosmarino). The sides that come with the entrees are amazing too - mashed potato with the chicken and broccoli rabe with the salmon. If I had to pick the best dish here, it would be the grilled octopus. I think the only other place (similar price point) that matches up to the one served at this restaurant is Dafni's Greek Tavern. This one is saucier than its Greek counterpart, which is charred but super tender!Their desert menu is awesome too - the panna cotta. YUM! On one occasion when my friends and I ordered ~150 of food, we received three complimentary desserts! Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

I enjoyed a fantastic pre-theater dinner here with my mom last night! The service was great, and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend.The biggest highlight was the Costolette D'Agnello, lamb chops over a bed of broccoli rabe (subbed for potatoes) with a balsamic glaze. The lamb was cooked to perfection, and the glaze was delicious as well! The whole presentation of the plate was very elegant, with the vegetable under the lamb, stood up on end to make a triangle. Everything had an excellent blend of flavors. The Cavatelli di Grano Arso was great, with a nice sauce over well-cooked sausage, mushroom and pasta. We also liked the ensalada mixta, with a light and fresh vinaigrette and generous portion of greens, pear, and almonds.The service was very attentive. The servers/host were friendly and happy to accommodate gluten and dairy allergies. The also cleaned off the table in between courses, which was a nice added touch. The atmosphere was classy, with low lighting and music. Overall, a very enjoyable dinner!

We had a reservation for Saturday evening for a group of about 10 of us.  Our group was looking for some Italian food in the area so we could load up on carbs before the NYC Half and we were pleased to be able to get a reservation for our group size just a few days before (this was for 5pm though).  When we entered the restaurant was pretty quiet but got busy fast.  The table accommodated the group however the way the wine shelves are set up anyone along the back wall had to be really cautious not to bang their head into a shelf when standing up.  The food was good, most of us ordered a pasta dish but the mushroom bruschetta truly was delicious, I could eat that all day every day.  The seafood risotto special was also quite tasty but a bit overpriced.  I guess since it's a special restaurants get away with an up-charge since you aren't seeing the price on the menu.  I can't comment on the drinks or wine list as most of us weren't drinking.  The only negative is the time it took to get food.  They did ask if we were catching a show (we weren't) but one of our friends did have to be out in an hour and 20 min to be at work and it was cutting it VERY close for her to get her food and have time to eat.  I am not really sure why it took as long as it did considering how early it was.  Overall tasty meal in a a nice setting.  I don't know that I'd go out of my way to come back but when I'm looking for something in the area it will be on my list of considerations.

A large group of us did Saturday brunch here a few weekends ago. We wanted a place with drink specials and a variety of food options, and this place had all of that. For drinks, you can order a pitcher of mimosas, screwdrivers, or bloody marys for $20 or a single drink for $5. The pitcher serves about 6 people, so it makes sense in a group. They have an array of egg and sweet based options, but be careful if you look at the menu online ahead. It was different and the prices were also deceiving. We thought everything cost $8-10, but found out at the restaurant that it was $15-17. I had the four cheese omelette with potatoes. The omelette wasn't the best I've had, but the potatoes were really divine.The inside of the restaurant is fun, but it's cramped to say the least. The tables were close together, so It felt like everyone was on top of you. Service wasn't bad. The waiter stopped over a few times to check/refill waters. Overall, decent food, but not a go to brunch spot.

I had a terrible experience here for dinner Friday night. I found a hair in my food and the manager did not even apologize. Then to top it off, the item was not even taken off of the bill. Such a shame at the lack of hospitality and guest recovery showed by management as I have been here many times before but will now never come back

Made a reservation for St. Valentines day dinner way in advance. They were calling to confirm the reservation. Came there to realize that they have "some problems in the kitchen" and can't accommodate any more people even though they were full - clearly bigger party came and they give the tables away. IF YOU DON'T WANT YOUR EVENING TO BE RUINED GO TO A MORE RELIABLE PLACE. First 3 people I spoke with were just rude, 4th person was also rude but at least apologized after like 5 minutes of talking.
I was at the 45th St location; pleasant experience. Quick light dinner before a show: beef carpaccio and mussels. The service was attentive, fast and our choices tasted good!

Very Sad to say this restaurant is a far cry from what it was about 2 yrs ago! Their long time Mgr left and they haven't come close to replacing him. Majority of the staff are rude and unfriendly now - especially the bartenders! The place used to have great food and a fun vibe, no more. Also new policy of no changes to menu items - and the kitchen is too busy- they actually said that!  It looks like they forgot that their customers pay the bill, not them and if we don't return it is more lost revenue. Hope they make changes for the better but until then too many better restaurants nearby!

Sea bass with clams, mussels, potatoes and asparagus in a white wine and cream sauce $22, roasted vegetable salad was served in a baked cheese shell $13 and seasonal risotto was made to order- butternut squash, mushroom and chorizo $30. Skip Caesar salad, overly creamy without enough flavor $12. This branch is quieter and has better decor than the one between 54th and 55th streets. Great service!

This may be one of my new favorite restaurants in NYC. Absolutely everything on my plate was amazing! I ordered the special caprese salad which was highly recommended by the waiter and it was definitely far from disappointing. For my main dish, I ordered the ricotta and spinach tortellini which was not only freshly made, but the perfect portion to fill me up without over-stuffing. Mouth watering! I can't wait to go back!

Been here on a few occasions and always have an enjoyable experience. The wine selection is good, the food is delicious and flavorful and the service is great. It's dark and relatively noisy so don't bring grandma. The tables up front are a bit cozy but I didn't mind. Overall, lovely experience!

Shhhhh.. don't tell the tourists about this place... slightly off the beaten track and for good reason. It's fantastic and unspoiled. Had the feel of an upscale neighborhood restaurant with nary a tourist in sight (besides us).  I almost hate to give it away as Bocca is by far the best theatre district restaurant we've encountered compared to others in the vicinity based on food, service, ambiance and price. (This explains, in part, the 5 star rating).Slipped into the last table available sans reservation last night  and WOW....the evening went beautifully.Place was full with great vibey soundtrack - but we could easily hear each other.  Waiters were fast, attentive and unobtrusive.  Crusty hot fresh Italian bread with bruschetta dip, crisp cold wine, special dinners (husbands - half a lobster nested on homemade basil infused spaghetti with grilled scallops; mine creamy basic risotto with mushroom medley - molto bene!).  The just-right lighting/soundtrack volume, ambiance, lively crowd, fantastic fresh food and unbelievably beautiful entrees we saw whisking by to other tables --   means next time we'll order dessert and linger vs. heading out to our R&B concert. Bocca hit it - and our expectations - out of the park.  Wonderful hostess, too.  We'll be back. Just won't tell anyone else.. maybe...
